The Albumin-corrected Delta Ratio is used to assess the pattern of kidney dysfunction and whether it indicates acute kidney injury, particularly in cases that may involve acute tubular necrosis or other conditions.

The formula to calculate corrected Delta Ratio is:

Delta Ratio = ($\frac{\text{Urinary Creatinine}}{\text{Serum Creatinine}}$) * $\frac{\text{Serum Albumin}}{\text{Urinary Albumin}}$,
